name: Justin Bieber
description:
'''Justin Drew Bieber''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|b|iː|b|ər}} {{Respell|BEE|bər}}; born March 1, 1994) is a Canadian singer. Regarded as a prominent figure in contemporary [[popular music]], he rose to fame in the late 2000s after being discovered on [[YouTube]], and his debut [[extended play]], ''[[My World (Justin Bieber EP)|My World]]'' (2009), was met with international recognition and established him as a [[teen idol]].

Bieber rose to further fame with his debut album, ''[[My World 2.0]]'' (2010), which topped the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] — making him the youngest solo male to do so in 47 years. Its lead single, "[[Baby (Justin Bieber song)|Baby]]" (featuring [[Ludacris]]), became one of the [[List of best-selling singles in the United States|best selling singles]] in the United States, while its accompanying music video became [[List of most-disliked YouTube videos|the most disliked video on YouTube]]. His second album, ''[[Under the Mistletoe]]'' (2011), became the first [[Christmas album]] by a male artist to debut atop chart. Bieber explored [[dance-pop]] on his third album, ''[[Believe (Justin Bieber album)|Believe]]'' (2012); its [[acoustic music|acoustic]] re-release made him the first artist in ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' history to have five US number-one albums by the age of 18.

Bieber explored [[Electronic dance music|EDM]] with his 2015 single "[[Where Are Ü Now]]", which won the [[Grammy Award for Best Dance/Electronic Recording]]. This influenced his fourth album, ''[[Purpose (Justin Bieber album)|Purpose]]'' (2015), which yielded the singles "[[Love Yourself]]", "[[Sorry (Justin Bieber song)|Sorry]]", and "[[What Do You Mean?]]" — all three peaked the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], and simultaneously entered the top three spots on the [[UK singles chart]] — making him the [[UK Singles Chart records and statistics#Acts to occupy the top two|first musical act to do so]] in the chart's history. Two of his 2017 guest appearances — on [[DJ Khaled]]'s "[[I'm the One (DJ Khaled song)|I'm the One]]" and [[Luis Fonsi]]'s "[[Despacito (Justin Bieber song)|Despacito]]" — peaked atop the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, with the latter winning him a [[Latin Grammy Award for Best Urban Fusion/Performance|Latin Grammy Award]]. 

His fifth and sixth albums, ''[[Changes (Justin Bieber album)|Changes]]'' (2020) and ''[[Justice (Justin Bieber album)|Justice]]'' (2021), both topped the ''Billboard'' 200; the latter included his seventh US-number one single "[[Peaches (Justin Bieber song)|Peaches]]" and made him break [[Elvis Presley]]'s 1965 record for the youngest solo act to have eight US number-one albums. Also in 2021, he released his eighth US number-one single, "[[Stay (The Kid Laroi and Justin Bieber song)|Stay]]" (with [[the Kid Laroi]]). Bieber's seventh and eight album, ''[[Swag (Justin Bieber album)|Swag]]'' and ''[[Swag II]]'', were released in 2025.

Bieber is one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists]] of all time, with over 150 million units sold worldwide and five [[Diamond Certified|diamond]] certifications from the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). [[List of awards and nominations received by Justin Bieber|His accolades]] include two [[Grammy Awards]], one [[Latin Grammy Award]], eight [[Juno Awards]], two [[Brit Awards]], 26 [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], 18 [[American Music Awards]], and 22 [[MTV Europe Music Awards]] (the [[MTV Europe Music Award#Most nominated and winning artists|most wins]] for any artist). ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named him one of the [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]] in 2011, and ''[[Forbes]]''{{'}} listed him among the top ten [[Forbes Celebrity 100|most powerful celebrities]] from 2011 to 2013. ''Billboard'' ranked him the [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars of the 21st Century|eighth-greatest pop star of the 21st century]].
